intro: Oreobroma aridorum, commonly known as the desert stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually small and fleshy, helping to conserve water. Oreobroma aridorum produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
